extendedIngredients.name: almonds
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup chopped almonds or walnuts

extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 apple, grated or chopped (2 heaping cups)

extendedIngredients.name: carrot
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2-3 large carrot, grated or chopped (2 heaping cups)

recipes.title: Chopped Apple Quinoa Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 35 dollars.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Prep the ingredients and allow to chill in the fridge. I've had best results with mixing when the quinoa is cool and crumbly instead of hot and sticky.Combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl and toss until well combined. Serve immediately, either plain, with chips, or on fresh greens.

steps.step: Prep the ingredients and allow to chill in the fridge. I've had best results with mixing when the quinoa is cool and crumbly instead of hot and sticky.
Combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl and toss until well combined.
Serve immediately, either plain, with chips, or on fresh greens.
